title: ICE 1
summary: The ICE 1 is the first batch-produced German high-speed train and one of six in the Intercity Express family. Revenue service at speeds up to 250 km/h (155.3 mph) started in 1991. It was raised to 280 km/h (174.0 mph) in May 1995 and temporary reduced to 250 km/h (155.3 mph) again, as a result of the Eschede accident.
